intro: Webera kurzii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with a contrasting throat. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Webera kurzii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
